dk.statsbiblioteket.util
Class XProperties

java.lang.Object
  java.util.Dictionary<K,V>
      java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Object>
          java.util.Properties
              dk.statsbiblioteket.util.XProperties
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.thoughtworks.xstream.converters.Converter, com.thoughtworks.xstream.converters.ConverterMatcher, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.util.Map<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Object>
@QAInfo(state=QA_NEEDED,
        level=NORMAL)
public class XProperties
extends java.util.Properties
implements com.thoughtworks.xstream.converters.Converter

Human Readable Properties with XStream backend.

An extension of java.util.properties, that uses XStream from Thoughtworks to create human readable property files for many different objects. The store(), load(java.lang.String, boolean, boolean), storeToXML(java.io.OutputStream, java.lang.String) and loadFromXML(java.io.InputStream) calls are overwritten.

XProperties provides storage in human readable XML. It also allows for easy storage of arbitrary complex objects, within the bounds of XStream. See xstream.codehaus.org for details.

The properties can be overridden from the command line, by setting the environment in the following manner:
-DXProperty:foo=bar -DXProperty:mysubproperty/foo=bar Slashes separates sub properties. -?[0-9]+ are stored as integers, -?[0-9]+\.[0-9]+ are stored as doubles, true and false are stored as booleans, all other values are stored as Strings.

File Format

FIXME: The file format is currently broken. See bug 1189

See Also:

XProperties

public XProperties(java.lang.String resourceName,
                   XProperties defaults)
            throws InvalidPropertiesException,
                   java.io.IOException
Initialise a set of properties with defaults, and load properties from resourceName. If resourceName is not found, initialise an empty set of resources, but use the name as filename on next call to store(). See load(String, boolean, boolean) for details about how resources are loaded.

Parameters:
resourceName - Name of resource.
defaults - Default properties.
Throws:
InvalidPropertiesException - if resourceName is found but not well-formed.
java.io.IOException - if resourceName is found but has io errors while reading.

XProperties

public XProperties(java.lang.String resourceName,
                   boolean fetchProperties)
            throws InvalidPropertiesException,
                   java.io.IOException
Initialize a set of properties. If fetchProperties is true, the properties is filled with stored values. If false, a clean properties is created.

Parameters:
resourceName - the name of the resource for these properties
fetchProperties - true if the properties should be fetched
Throws:
InvalidPropertiesException - if resourceName is found but not well-formed.
java.io.IOException - if resourceName is found but has io errors while reading.

XProperties

public XProperties(java.lang.String resource,
                   boolean createNew,
                   boolean failOnNotFound)
            throws InvalidPropertiesException,
                   java.io.IOException
If createNew is true, create a blank set of properties. If createNew is false, attempt to retrieve the properties from resource. If the attempt fails because the resource could not be localed and failOnNotfound is true, throw an IOException.

Parameters:
resource - the resource to use as basis for the XProperties.
createNew - if true, a clean XProperties (filled from the environment) is created with resource as its name.
failOnNotFound - if true and createNew is false and the resource is not available, an IOException will be thrown.
Throws:
InvalidPropertiesException - if the resource was not proper XProperties XML.
java.io.IOException - if the resource was invalid or if the resource did not exist and failOnNotFound was true.

XProperties

public XProperties(boolean override)
Construct a XProperties, potentially without letting the environment override any properties.

Parameters:
override - if true, let the environment override properties.

get

@Deprecated
public java.lang.Object get(java.lang.Object key)
Deprecated. replaced by {link #getObject(String)} which supports defaults

Wrapper for the get method inherited from HashTable, in order to mark it as deprecated. The get from HashTable doesn't fall back to the defaults, if the object isn't present in the properties.

Specified by:
get in interface java.util.Map<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Object>
Overrides:
get in class java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Object>
Parameters:
key - the key for the object property
Returns:
an object, or null, if it doesn't exist in the first layer of properties

Parameters:

Returns:
The previous default value for this object, if any.

populateWithDefaults

public void populateWithDefaults()
Promotes properties in the defaults set to properties in the main set. This is useful to make store() store an xml file with default settings for users to change at will. Note that this will recursively populate defaults up through the default settings.

getXStream

public com.thoughtworks.xstream.XStream getXStream()
Provides access to the XStream instance. This is useful for extending XStream handling for specific objects. If the extension is for a generic object, consider changing the XProperties, so that other projects can benefit from the work.

Returns:
The XStream instance used by the XProperties instance when storing and loading objects.

properties - another set of propeerties to assign to this.

load

public void load(java.lang.String resourceName,
                 boolean ignoreNonExisting,
                 boolean ignoreMalformed)
          throws InvalidPropertiesException,
                 java.io.IOException
Fetch stored properties from the given resource. This uses ContextClassLoader, so as long as the resource is in the CLASSPATH, it should be accessible. The resource is searched for in the following order: - If the resource can be found in defaultPath, use this - Else if the resource can be found in current directory use this - Else if the resource can be found in classpath, use this

Parameters:
resourceName - the name of the resource containing the properties
ignoreNonExisting - don't throw an exception if the resource can not be found
ignoreMalformed - don't throw an exception if the resource is malformed
Throws:
InvalidPropertiesException - if the ignores aren't true and the resource contains unknown classes
java.io.IOException - thrown if there are IO errors during read OR if resource is not found and ignoreNonExisting is false.

load

public void load(java.io.InputStream instream)
          throws java.io.IOException
Fetch stored properties from the given stream.

Overrides:
load in class java.util.Properties
Parameters:
instream - Input stream to read properties from.
Throws:
InvalidPropertiesException - if the stream contains unknown or invalid classes
java.io.IOException - thrown if there are IO errors during read OR if resource is not found and ignoreNonExisting is false.

store

public void store()
           throws java.io.IOException
Store the properties as the resource given in previous load(resourceName) or store(resourceName) calls. Equivalent to calling store(resourceName).

Throws:
java.io.IOException - if the resource could not be stored
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no calls have set a resourceName

store

public void store(java.lang.String resourceName)
           throws java.io.IOException
Store the properties as the resource named by resourceName. The ressource is first searched for in the same order as for load(). If found and in writable directory, it is replaced. If it does not exist, a new file is created at the default directory, with the name resourceName. Note: Trying to replace a resource placed anywhere else than a write-enabled directory, will give an IOException.

Parameters:
resourceName - the name of the resource to store the properties to
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if the resource could not be stored

store

public void store(java.io.OutputStream out,
                  java.lang.String comments)
           throws java.io.IOException
Store the properties in the given outputStream.

Overrides:
store in class java.util.Properties
Parameters:
out - the stream to store the properties to
comments - ignored - only for compatibility with java.util.Properties.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if the resource could not be stored
